intro: Croton sucrensis, commonly known as the Suceño croton, is a shrub native to parts of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful foliage with leaves that often display shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant produces small, inconspicuous green flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and greenhouses.
